Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the room is very large and clean also the toilet is very clean and nice reception is very nice:) the price is reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in Wilmersdorf area”
Reviews.Author: chrstphr d
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at de Ela. Hotel is situated in the classic German building, it has spacious rooms, comfortable beds and matrasses. It is quite clean, quiet, and relaxing. It offers good breakfast (few sorts of ham and salami, cheese, fresh bread rolls, yoghurts, selection of tees, coffees and juice). The hotel is situated in the Wilmersdorfer and Schoneber area quite close to Berlin’s West City Centre. There are bus, metro and train links to the hotel. As you would expect from German’s capital, you do not really need to wait for too long for anything, including public transport. Overall, we enjoyed our stay in this pleasant hotel with welcoming staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for B&B!”
Reviews.Author: kimberlychrisc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because a friend of mine recommended it to me. They got an informative site which offers incentives, discounts and special offers for guests booking direct with them. I took advantage of that, and, to my surprise, got a bottle of champagne on arrival – I thought it was beautiful! My room was clean and well-decorated, the design is not really that fancy – but classic hotel look is there. Room was quite spacious and warm. Hotel is in the quiet (too quiet?) residential street just off the city centre. That was quite an interesting contrast – buzzling city centre minutes-walk away and quiet place to retire late at night. Buildings in the area are very interesting – Germany in its beauty! Schoneberg attractions are quite close to the hotel. Alexanderplatz is on another side of the city centre though. Breakfast is OK. I would suggest adding a few more items to the menu though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Berlin Centre”
Reviews.Author: gijosp
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Ela is a very good Hotel. It is more of a Family-hotel though. There is no big brand behind it, rather a welcoming couple at reception desk. I felt a little like at home, and not in the hotel. It is located in centre, it has a couple of U-Bahn stations next door, it is close to Ku-damm, KaDeWe and West Berlin City. There are direct lines to Zoologischer Garten, Potsdamer Platz and other destinations. Rooms are well equipped (the safe is missing though!), good TVs, German and English channels, not LCD. Our room was facing the street and had large windows. Staff is welcoming and accommodating. We also made many friends with other travellers staying at Hotel de Ela which was fun! I will come back to de Ela when I am next in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “so-called 3 star hotel, but no star hostel”
Reviews.Author: rrbangkok
Reviews.Content: one of the worst places i have stayed in during all my travels. the rooms are spacious, but with very old and dusty furniture and curtains that only cover half of the windows when completely closed. lights in the hallways turn off automatically after a minute or so, which is very inconvenient if you have to go to your external bathroom in the middle of the night. breakfast is overcharged, you pay 5.95 EUR per person, and get a plate with a stale bread roll, some cheese and meat that has been out on the counter for the entire morning. the service is unacceptable and the staff at reception is very rude. some of the staff don't speak German, which is a bit of a nightmare when you need them to call a taxi to the airport, especially because they claim on their website they have 'multilingual staff'. you pay for a 3 star room, but get no service or amenities in return. i wouldn't recommend anybody to stay there, even for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, but a lot of misunderstandings that don-t seem so”
Reviews.Author: soulfuljourney
Reviews.Content: On the good side: The rooms, as said before, are huge (at least ours) and confortable. Location is also good. Breakfast was ok. On the bad: They charged us for everything except leaving our luggage for a couple of hours on the last day. Extra days that were their fault, extra bed that was already in the room... everything impossible to discuss because the family (owners) apparently can´t speak english well enough to mantain a conversation. Their main interest is billing. But if you are wise enough to keep up with this in a diplomatic way, they might still smile at you. Not to us, though.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, but adequate.”
Reviews.Author: ChillNw
Reviews.Content: The rooms are variable, some are large, very large, and some are very small - all at the same price. We had a double room that you couldn't swing a cat in, but having said that it was very clean. Did have a problem with the bed, think they should have taken it back to MFI, but that was fixed when we pointed it out. We were part of a group that had booked 13 en-suite rooms, however on arrival we found that only 11 were available. One of the two rooms that I had booked was not en-suite and the only compensation offered was 2 cans of warm beer, shameful! Breakfast was pretty basic, but I thought that it was Ok for a continental. On a positive note, the hotel is quite close to the western side of Berlin, and within an easy walk to Metro. Also the Europa Centre was within easy reach. Not too happy about our rooms, but had a good break.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but not great”
Reviews.Author: RussWWFC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of friends in early May 2011. As a previous reviewer states, we ordered en suite rooms 8 months in advance yet they could not supply us with them on the day. That was after they had kept us waiting around for 3 hours after we arrived. All we got in compensation was a few warm cans of cheap beer. The rooms were clean but very basic, though to be fair my own room was spacious. Breakfast was a basic cheese, ham, roll, yoghurt etc, not a huge selection of stuff and it tended to be using the super cheap budget products. Location was decent, central Berlin was walkable within 20 minutes and the busy road outside did not keep me awake. Best thing about the hotel was the free WiFi - it was quick, easy to log on and a real godsend as data is so expensive on phones abroad these days.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality for a surprisingly low price”
Reviews.Author: Lovem2006
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel with 2 young kids in May 2011 for one night. We felt like at home. Really appreciate a big room with the old-aged furniture and high ceiling! The staff attitude was very warm and helpful. The location is very good - we walked to the Zoo for about 15 minutes, a nice small park with fountains is nearby, metro is at walking distance. The street looks noisy but it did not discturb us at all at night (though i'm very sensitive to noise). A lot of small bakeries and italian restaurants are around. We did not try breakfast as we had to leave early but we were kindly provided with sandwhiches and jogurts. Needless to say that the price is very reasonable and affordable compared to hotels and even hostels around and include the breakfast. Would definitely stay here again and recommend it to everyone for a short stay. Would like to add that the Hotel Manager Denis is very responsive in mails and helped us a lot before we arrived - taxi, advices etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 3 Star Hotel but good value”
Reviews.Author: fspiegel
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel run by some Russians and it is located like an appartment inside a big house in a residential area. There is no big sign outside. If you are lucky, you get a room with your own bathroom. Otherwise it's in the hallway. The 3-bedrooms are spacious enough but the matress, pillows and blankets are not very comfortable. The location is quite good. My only real criticism is toward the breakfast which consists of the cheapest stuff you can get at the cheapest discounter supermarket (probably Lidl). The rolls made me feel ashamed since I promised my friends that Germany is the home country of the best bread in the world. The yogurt was standing outside the fridge for hours and is probably recycled the next day! The coffee was merely agua de calcetin! Also there was no shampoo available (which actually is a prerequisite for getting a 3 star ranking in Germany) - only some liquid soap (also from Lidl). The outside street has some traffic and it's thus a bit noisy but acceptable. One of the three-bed rooms has a very nice couch and is therefore quite cozy. Just outside there is a very nice French bakery. Go there if you want a real breakfast with good coffee and croissants! Free WiFi!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly service, very spacious!!”
Reviews.Author: den_explorer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled to this hotel in February this year for 3 nights. We absolutely enjoyed enjoyed our stay - I would highly recommend this hotel - great customer service, central location, low prices, large rooms. We also enjoyed free w-fi and wondefful surroundings. The only problem we had is that weather in Berlin was not too good then! Otherwise would highly recommend anyone who is visiting Berlin as a couple or a family!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Hotel De Ela!”
Reviews.Author: Guest274951
Reviews.Content: 1. First time I saw a hotel with so friendly staff (English, Deutch or Russian - no problems with language). 2. Price of our rooms was unbelieveble! Cheapest place in the Berlin center. 3. Clean Rooms. 4. I will reccomend this hotel to everyone who want's to have the rest in Berlin! Excellent!!!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel De Ela
HotelInfo.Address: Landshuter Str. 1, 10779 Berlin, Germany
